1.title: Lanterns: The Harvest Festival
1.plot: Welcome to Season 4 of TableTop! In this first episode, Wil Wheaton hosts a game of Lanterns: The Harvest Festival. Joining him are Zac Eubank, Becca Scott Kerns, and Ivan Van Norman!

2.title: Champions of Midgard
2.plot: Wil Wheaton hosts a game of Champions of Midgard! Alongside him in this epic Viking journey are Alison Haislip, Chris Kluwe, and Marisha Ray.

3.title: Monarch
3.plot: Wil Wheaton hosts a game of Monarch! Joined by Ashley Clements, Brea Grant, and Satine Phoenix, the four have to channel their inner princess and claim the crown!

4.title: Tiny Epic Galaxies
4.plot: Wil Wheaton invites Mayim Bialik, Tim Schafer, and Andy Weir to colonize planets in Tiny Epic Galaxies!

5.title: Fury of Dracula Pt. 1
5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

6.title: Fury of Dracula Pt. 2
6.plot: In part two of this two-part edition of TableTop, vampire hunters Amy Okuda, Grant Imahara, and Ify Nwadiwe try their best to defeat Wil Wheaton, aka Dracula, in Fury of Dracula!

7.title: Harbour
7.plot: Wil Wheaton invites guests Nika Harper, Matthew Mercer, and Kyle Newman to find out can buy the most valuable buildings, in Harbour!

8.title: Dragon Farkle
8.plot: This week on TableTop, it's Dragon Farkle! Wil Wheaton is joined by Brandon Routh, Derek Mio, and Neil Grayston. The objective: build an army and defeat the dragon!

9.title: Star Realms
9.plot: Wil Wheaton invites Melissa Detora to join him in a game of Star Realms! Star Realms is a fast-paced, two-player deck building combat game, where the goal is to reduce your opponent's score to zero.

10.title: Fate Core RPG
10.plot: Wil Wheaton invites Felicia Day, John Rogers, and Ryan Macklin in a game of Fate Core! Fate Core is a setting-neutral RPG, meaning it can be run in any setting you choose.

11.title: Star Trek: Five-Year Mission
11.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

12.title: Mysterium
12.plot: Wil believes that ghosts aren't real, mediums don't talk to departed spirits, and psychics are full of crap. But, just this once, he'll set those beliefs aside and welcome them all as real for a fun game of Mysterium! Joined by David Kwong, Laura Bailey, and Shannon Woodward, the four attempt to solve a murder by communicating with the departed.

13.title: Steam Park
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

14.title: Misspent Youth Pt. 1
14.plot: In part 1 of Misspent Youth, Wil Wheaton sits down with Amy Dallen, Kelly Sue DeConnick, and Matt Fraction to imagine a dystopian world where power has been concentrated into the hands of one centralized authority. They are a group of teenage rebels who have had enough!

15.title: Misspent Youth Pt. 2
15.plot: In part 2 of Misspent Youth, Wil Wheaton sits down with Amy Dallen, Kelly Sue DeConnick, and Matt Fraction to imagine a dystopian world where power has been concentrated into the hands of one centralized authority. They are a group of teenage rebels who have had enough!

16.title: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
16.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

17.title: Welcome to the Dungeon
17.plot: Today on TableTop, Janet Varney, Hector Navarro, and Rhea Butcher sit down with Wil Wheaton to play Welcome to the Dungeon, a bluffing and press-your-luck microgame where you work together to get through two dungeons without dying.

18.title: Codenames
18.plot: Two teams of super spies have come in from the cold, but many fellow agents missed the memo. Wil Wheaton is joined by Michele Morrow, Travis Willingham, John Ross Bowie, Jackie Kashian, and Ashley Esqueda to bring these agents back in, in CODENAMES!

19.title: Eldritch Horror: Part 1
19.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

20.title: Eldritch Horror: Part 2
20.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Small World
1.plot: Wil Wheaton and guests Jenna Busch, Grant Imahara, and Sean "Day[9]" Plott play Small World.

2.title: Settlers of Catan
2.plot: Wil Wheaton and guests Neil Grayston, James Kyson, and Jane Espenson play The Settlers of Catan.

3.title: Zombie Dice, Get Bit, & Tsuro
3.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation) joins YouTube superstars Freddie Wong (freddiew) and Ryan Higa (NigaHiga) alongside Rod Roddenberry (Star Trek) for a quick bout of Zombie Dice and Tsuro.

4.title: Ticket to Ride
4.plot: Wil Wheton (Star Trek: The Next Generation) plays alongside Anne Wheaton, Amy Dallen, and Colin Fergusen (Eureka) to build railroads and compete for longest route in Ticket to Ride. But will game board disaster strike?

5.title: Munchkin
5.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Felicia Day (The Guild), and Sandeep Parikh (The Guild) fight monsters and stab each other in the back in Munchkin, alongside its creator Steve Jackson.

6.title: Castle Panic
6.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Yuri Lowenthal (Prince of Persia), Andre Meadows (BlackNerdComedy), and Tara Platt (Naruto) protect the castle from an onslaught of trolls in Castle Panic.

7.title: Gloom
7.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Amber Benson (Buffy the Vampire Slayer), Michele Boyd (The Guild), and Meghan Camerena (Strawburry17) convey their families tragic tales as they play Gloom.

8.title: Fiasco, Part 1
8.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Bonnie Burton (The Star Wars Craft Book), Alison Haislip (Battleground), and John Rogers (Leverage) begin their sexy, 1970s-inspired story in Fiasco Part 1. From low rent stripping to Hollywood hijinks, this tale has it all!

9.title: Fiasco, Part 2
9.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Bonnie Burton (The Star Wars Craft Book), Alison Haislip (Battleground), and John Rogers (Leverage)conclude their sexy, 1970s-inspired story in Fiasco Part 2. From low rent stripping to Hollywood hijinks, this tale has it all!

10.title: Say Anything
10.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Josh A. Cagan (Undergrads, Bandslam), Matt Mira (The Nerdist Podcast), and Jonah Ray find out who's funnier in Say Anything, the perfect family board game.

11.title: Elder Sign
11.plot: Wil Wheaton and guests Felicia Day, Mike Morhaime, and Bill Prady play Elder Sign.

12.title: Dixit
12.plot: Wil Wheaton and guests Leo Chu, Casey McKinnon, and Beth Riesgraf play Dixit.

13.title: Wits & Wagers
13.plot: Wil Wheaton and guests Veronica Belmont, Phil LaMarr, and Jimmy Wong play Wits & Wagers: Family Edition.

14.title: Pandemic
14.plot: Wil Wheaton and guests Morgan Webb, Ed Brubaker, and Robert Gifford play Pandemic.

15.title: Last Night on Earth
15.plot: Zombies! Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation) and Felicia Day (The Guild) are after Riki Lindhome (Garfunkel and Oates) and Kate Micucci's brains in this terrifying and exhilirating game of Last Night on Earth.

16.title: Star Fluxx
16.plot: Wil Wheaton, Alex Albrecht, Chloe Dykstra, and Jordan Mechner try to keep up with the constantly changing rules of Star Flux.

17.title: Alhambra
17.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Ashley Johnson (Ben 10, The Killing), Dodger Leigh (Press Heart to Continue), and Shane Nickerson (Ridiculousness) compete to build the most beautiful palace in Alhambra.

18.title: Chez Geek
18.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Storm DiCostanzo (Paul and Storm), Andrew Hackard (Steve Jackson Games), and Paul Sabourin (Paul and Storm) find out what it would be like for nerds to live together in Chez Geek. Harmony doesn't seem likely, with this mismatched gang.

19.title: Dragon Age, Part 1
19.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Chris Hardwick (Nerdist), Kevin Sussman (The Big Bang Theory), and Sam Witwer (Being Human) go back to their roots of RPGs and delve into the fantastical world of Dragon Age. Part 1.

20.title: Dragon Age, Part 2
20.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Chris Hardwick (Nerdist), Kevin Sussman (The Big Bang Theory), and Sam Witwer (Being Human) go back to their roots of RPGs and delve into the fantastical world of Dragon Age. Part 2.

1.title: Formula D
1.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation) joins YouTubers Greg Benson (MedicoreFilms), Hannah Hart (My Drunk Kitchen), and Grace Helbig (it'sGrace) as they race across the tracks of the Monaco Grand Prix.

2.title: The Resistance
2.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Ashley Clemments (The Lizzie Bennet Diaries), Felicia Day (Supernatural, The Guild), Amy Okuda (The Guild), and Allison Scagliotti (Warehouse 13) attempt to distinguish friend from foe in a game of spies and deception.

3.title: Once Upon a Time
3.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), producers Amy Berg (Eureka) and Mike Phirman (Napoleon Dynamite), and YouTuber Chris Wyatt build off of one another to tell the perfect story. Whomever reaches their predetermined ending first wins!

4.title: King of Tokyo
4.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Greg Zeschuk (Beer Diaries), and YouTubers John Bain (TotalHalibut) and Craig Bensine (WheezyWaiter), and fight to be the last monster standing. Who will be the King of Tokyo? Watch and find out!

5.title: Forbidden Island
5.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation) works together with Bobak Ferdowsi (NASA), drummer Jason Finn, and author John Scalzi (Old Man's War) in an attempt to escape a sinking island before time runs out.

6.title: Smash Up
6.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Cara Santa Maria (Talk Nerdy podcast), Rich Sommer (Mad Men), and video game producer Jen Timms battle one another to determine which creatures are the most weird and the most awesome.

7.title: Star Trek Catan
7.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Jeri Ryan (Star Trek: Voyager), Kari Wahlgren (Kung Fu Panda), and Ryan Wheaton collect resources and build spaceships and star bases to settle in the final frontier.

8.title: Star Wars X-Wing
8.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Clare Grant (Team Unicorn), Seth Green (Family Guy, Robot Chicken), and YouTuber Mike Lamond (HuskyStarcraft) join the rebel alliance and galactic empire in an epic battle. Which team will the force be with?

9.title: Lords of Waterdeep
9.plot: Join Wil Wheaton and a bevy of celebrity guests take on the best in tabletop gaming for a fast-paced and hilarity-filled show.

10.title: Shadows Over Camelot
10.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Jerry Holkins (Penny Arcade), Mike Krahulik (Penny Arcade), and Tara Strong (My Little Pony, The Fairly Oddparents) join King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table to help defend Camelot or secretly sabotage it.

11.title: Betrayal at House on the Hill, Part 1
11.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

12.title: Betrayal at House on the Hill, Part 2
12.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Ashly Burch (Borderlands 2, Attack on Titan), Keahu Kahuanui (Teen Wolf), and Michael Swaim (Cracked.com contributor) work together to explore a mansion until one of them is randomly chosen to betray the others. This is part 2.

13.title: Takenoko
13.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Drew Roy (Falling Skies), and YouTubers Harley Morenstein (Epic Meal Time) and Rosanna Pansino (Nerdy Nummies) take turns maintaining the emperor's royal garden while also feeding a sacred, hungry panda.

14.title: Unspeakable Words
14.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Troy Baker (The Last of Us, BioShock), Felicia Day (Supernatural, The Guild), and Erin Gray (Buck Rogers) taunt Cthulhu and assemble unspeakable words.

15.title: Qwirkle and 12 Days
15.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Kelly Hu (X-Men 2), Meredith Salenger (The Journey of Natty Gann), and Nolan Kopp use strategy to test their luck in two separate games; one of shapes and the other of numbers.

16.title: Carcassonne
16.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Kumail Nanjiani (Life as We Know It, Sex Tape), and YouTubers Jesse Cox and Nika Harper take turns building cities, roads, monasteries, and farms in an attempt to secure the most points.

17.title: Tsuro of the Seas
17.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Brendan Halloran (Space Janitors), Andy Hull (Space Janitors), and Kevin Pereira (E! News, Attack of the Show) journey into uncharted waters full of unpredictable, ship-eating dragons.

18.title: Ticket to Ride Europe
18.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Emma Caulfield (Buffy the Vampire Slayer), John Kovalic, and Anne Wheaton race to build train routes across Europe until they run out of trains. All aboard!

19.title: Fortune and Glory
19.plot: Wil Wheaton (Star Trek: The Next Generation), Felicia Day (Supernatural, The Guild), Ryon Day, and Brandon Routh (Superman Returns, Scott Pilgrim vs. the World) jump back to the late 1930s and try to collect the most magical items.

21.title: Lords of Vegas
21.plot: Miracle Laurie (actress, Dollhouse) and Angela and Aubrey Webber (The Doubleclicks) join host Wil Wheaton to play Lords of Vegas, an economic-driven area control game where the stakes are high and the potential rewards are even higher.

1.title: Tokaido
1.plot: J. August Richards (actor, Agents of Shield), Jason Wishnov (video game designer, Iridium studios) and Chris Kluwe (former Minnesota Viking, all-around good dude) join host Wil Wheaton to play the set collecting game Tokaido.

2.title: Forbidden Desert
2.plot: Felicia Day (Geek & Sundry founder), Alan Tudyk (actor, Con Man) and Jon Heder (actor, Benchwarmers) join host Wil Wheaton to play Forbidden Desert, a cooperative-play game with steampunk elements.

3.title: Catan Junior
3.plot: Catan Junior is a pirate-themed reworking of Settlers of Catan which simplifies it for younger audiences, and host Wil Wheaton invites a few kids to play the game with him: Emily Anderson, Brett Baligad and Adam Chernick.

4.title: Hare & Tortoise/Council of Verona
4.plot: Alison Haislip (actress, Con Man), Jessica Merizan (cosplayer and YouTuber) and David Kwong (magician, puzzle creator) join host Wil Wheaton to play two simple but awesome games: Hare & Tortoise and Council of Verona.

5.title: Stone Age
5.plot: Nika Harper (video host, author) and YouTubers Jesse Cox and Jordan "CaptainSparklez" Maron visit Tabletop to play the worker placement and resource management game Stone Age with host Wil Wheaton.

6.title: Geek Out!
6.plot: Bonnie Burton (writer), Clare Kramer (actress, Buffy the Vampire Slayer), Anne Wheaton (co-creator, Vandaleyes) and host Wil Wheaton play a variant game of Geek Out by adding in the Geek Out Pop Culture Party deck to the original deck.

7.title: Sheriff of Nottingham
7.plot: Wil Wheaton invites Ashley Clements (actress, The Lizzie Bennett Diaries), Derek Mio (actor, Spooked) and Meredith Salenger (actor, The Journey of Natty Gann) to play Sheriff of Nottingham, a game that pits bribing against extortion.

8.title: Dead of Winter
8.plot: Ashley Johnson (actress, Blindspot), Grant Imahara (former host, Mythbusters) and Dodger Leigh (YouTuber, Press Heart to Continue) play Dead of Winter, a cooperative play game with a defector, with host Wil Wheaton.

9.title: Epic Spell Wars
9.plot: It's a podcaster beat-down when Emily V. Gordon (producer and podcaster), Jonah Ray (comedian and podcaster) and Veronica Belmont (tv host and podcaster) join host (and podcaster) Wil Wheaton for a few rounds of Epic Spell Wars.

10.title: Cards Against Humanity
10.plot: In a rare NSFW, non-family-friendly episode, Wil Wheaton and guests Aisha Tyler (actress, Archer), Laina Morris (Overly Attached Girlfriend), Ali Spagnola (musician, comedian) play a typically filthy game of Cards Against Humanity.

11.title: Five Tribes
11.plot: Wil Wheaton invites Jenna Busch (entertainment reporter), Satine Phoenix (comic book artist), and Richard Garriott (video game developer) to play Five Tribes, a worker placement game with a mancala mechanic.

12.title: Concept
12.plot: Rhett McLaughlin and Link Neal (comedians, Rhett and Link) and Joseph Scrimshaw (comedian/podcaster, Obsessed) join host Wil Wheaton to play Concept, an innovative communication game Wil describes as "Pictionary for writers."

13.title: Dread: Part 1
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

14.title: Dread: Part 2
14.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

15.title: Libertalia
15.plot: Seth Green (voice actor, Family Guy), Karen Gillan (actress, Guardians of the Galaxy) and Clare Grant (co-founder, Team Unicorn) join host Wil Wheaton for a swashbuckling adventure playing Libertalia.

16.title: Love Letter & Coup
16.plot: Felicia Day (writer, actor, producer) and Benny and Rafi Fine (YouTubers, Fine Brothers Entertainment) join host Wil Wheaton to play two games: Love Letter and Coup, both micro games that don't take too much time to play.

17.title: Kingdom Builder
17.plot: Paul Scheer (podcaster, How Did This Get Made), Tara Platt (actor/writer/producer, Shelf Life) and Yuri Lowenthal (actor/writer/producer, Shelf Life) join host Wil Wheaton to play the area control game called Kingdom Builder.

18.title: Legendary
18.plot: Wil Wheaton brings together Allie Brosh (creator, Hyperbole and a Half), Mark Fischbach (Youtube's Markiplier) and Brea Grant (actress, Heroes) to play Legendary, a deck-building game set in the Marvel Comics universe.

19.title: Roll for It & Sushi Go!
19.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

20.title: Mice & Mystics, Chapter One
20.plot:

21.title: Mice & Mystics, Chapter Two
21.plot:

imdb.title: TableTop
plot: Wil Wheaton hosts tabletop games featuring three other celebrity players.::SightSpirit
